sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: John of Bologna, Summa notariae. Papal and Ecclesiastical Documents
Ioh. de Bononia, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 188 128 , 7.4 x 5.3, ff. 1 + 26 + 129, double and single columns mostly 35-36 lines. In several hands, the predominant one being a legal type of hand of cent. xiii-xiv.
A rather large proportion of the documents refer to Durham. The book was probably the property of a notarial personage in that diocese.

msItem.head: John of Bologna, Summa notariae

head.title: Summa magistri Ioannis de Bononia Ioanni archiepiscopo Cantuar. dedicata de arte tabellionatus in curia Romana

msItem.explicit: prebendam ut ad eam admittantur

dum mihi sunt testes erimus pilade(s) et horestes, etc.

msItem.head: Walter of Bibbesworth, Treatise on the French language

head.title: Versus Gallica lingua scripti

msItem.ab: Double columns (Gautier de Bibbesworth)
msItem.rubric: Ici comence ascun estrange paroles de fraunce

lg.l: Quant lui enfes est nee
Lors deit estre mailiole
Lenfant en berz est coche
E par sa norice est berce

msItem.ab: The English glosses are given
It seems to be finished by another hand
The two last lines in the first hand are

lg.l: Assez auera des esclauoz
Qui de chiuals suyent les escloz
Les feus ostes de puant fouse
ffount sale nape et table graciouse
Herbe cressant a luys de stable
ffet blaunche nape et megre table.
Ie vey cy venir mestre hughe
Qui rien ne parle sil ne bughe, etc.

msItem.ab: The last line is mutilated
See Romania IV 375; XIII 500

head.title: XXXVI Folies et qui les entent XXXVI sens aprent

msItem.incipit: Qui nul bien set ne nul ne voet aprendre
msItem.explicit: Qui bien ad fait e puis se repent
msItem.ab: Printed from another MS. in Rel. Ant. II 236. See Romania XV 340

head.title: Proverbes de Fraunce

lg.l: A bon demaundour bon escundur
A bon jour bon hure

msItem.ab: Alphabetical; On p. 253 sqq. single lines: ending
msItem.explicit: Voide chambre fait fole dame. Vsage rend mestre
msItem.rubric: Jci finisent Bourdes folies et prouerbes de ffraunce
msItem.ab: Ed. in Le Roux de Lincy Livre des proverbes Français ed. 2, II 472

head.title: De notre dame

msItem.incipit: Nul ne doit mounter en pris sil neyt damur empris que cest trop bel enpris, etc.
msItem.explicit: hors de la terre morruse en la vie amourouse ou chescun autre amera

head.title: Rime estrange, 'Enchauntant concordray. vn chant que a concorder ay'
Rime estrange

msItem.incipit: Enchauntant concordray. vn chant que a concorder ay. en acordant concordaunce
msItem.explicit: qe nous puisseoms concorder et par ta mere acorder a tey de noz grant descordes. Amen

head.title: French verse, 'Amours me unt si enchaunte'
Uncor autre ryme

msItem.incipit: Amours me unt si enchaunte qe ieo ay tutdis deschaunte tut quant qe ieo chauntey
msItem.explicit: ore vous ai de aue rome veez si ieo ai bien rime

head.title: French verse, 'Malade sui de ioie espris tant suspire qe ne repos'
Autre maner de rime

lg.l: Malade sui de ioie espris tant suspire qe ne repos
Jeo ai mon quor en pense mys et si enpens de mile chose

msItem.explicit: et gelusie et molt de gent en ount anvye
msItem.ab: Ed. P. Meyer, Romania IV 375

head.title: French verse, 'Ieo men voys dame a deu vous comaund'

msItem.incipit: Ieo men voys dame a deu vous comaund
msItem.explicit: quant ieo ne puis auoir nul autre eye ore doint deus qe mort men deslye
msItem.ab: Ed. P. Meyer, Romania IV 375

head.title: French verse, 'En la sesoune qe lerbe poynt e reverdist la matinee'
Rime bon

msItem.incipit: En la sesoune qe lerbe poynt e reuerdist la matinee
msItem.explicit: et ma repris enuoy a ceux enpris e si ie ai ren mespris bien voile qel soit mesprise
msItem.ab: Ed. P. Meyer, Romania IV 375

Epistola incerti autoris

msItem.incipit: Alexander ut legitur cum ultimum litus oceani perlustraret Bragmannorum insulam debellare parabat, etc.

Epistola vel tractatus qui incipit, Tristis est anima mea

msItem.incipit: Tristis est anima mea nec inuenit seu qualiter consoletur cum agnina capitis nostri mansuetudo in seuiciam leonine ferocitatis mutata, etc.

Letter to the bishop of Lincoln, recommending Giles de Bellonuilla for presentation to the church of Abbots Ripton

msItem.ab: 113 is followed by a document in another hand
msItem.incipit: Iohannes, etc. Ven. fr. episcopo Lincoln. ... Probitatis merita dilecti filii Egidii de Bellonuilla canonici eccl. de Aukeland
msItem.ab: Commends him for presentation to the Church of Rypton Abbatis (Abbots Ripton, Hunts.)
